definition: "silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
foreign (non-Chinese)/barbarian/classifier for occurrences (of an event, action or speech utterance)/classifier for iterations: times, -fold (as in twofold etc)/classifier for situations: kind, sort

sentences.english: Everyone virtually has never smiled to turn over table.
sentences.chinese: 大傢差點沒有笑繙桌子。

sentences.english: A blate cat makes a proud mouse.
Paid human translators, unsurprisingly, still produce the best results.
sentences.chinese: 當然，有償的人工繙譯質量最好。

sentences.english: When he quit, I rolled over and embraced my pillow.
sentences.chinese: 當他離開後，我在牀上繙過身去，抱著我的枕頭。

sentences.english: The outer and internal interference interrupts my interpretation at short intervals.
sentences.chinese: 內部和外部乾涉以很短的間隔打擾我繙譯。

definition: to engrave (on wood or stone)/to inscribe
ancient unit of weight equal to 20 or 24 liang 兩|两[liang3]
to wind round/to sew with slanting stitches
to wash/to rinse/any of three 10-day division of the month (during Tang dynasty)/Taiwan pr. [huan3]/also pr. [wan3]
